tip1.title: Context is King
tip1.description: Numbers without context are dangerous. Always use the text widget to explain WHY a number changed (e.g., 'Seasonality', 'New Competitor').

tip2.title: Focus on Trends, not Snapsots
tip2.description: Executives care about direction. Is the line going up or down? Show 12-month trailing charts.

tip3.title: Aggregate Data
tip3.description: Don't show campaign-level data. Roll it up to Channel or Region level. Keep it strategic.

tip4.title: Highlight Efficiency
tip4.description: Show ROAS or CPA prominently. Prove that the budget is being used efficiently.

tip5.title: Include Benchmarks
tip5.description: Compare performance against industry benchmarks or internal targets/forecasts.

tip6.title: Keep it One Page
tip6.description: If they have to scroll too much, you lost them. The key metrics should fit on one screen.

tip7.title: Prepare Answers
tip7.description: The dashboard will prompt questions. 'Why is CPA up?' Be ready to answer based on the drill-down data available to you.

faq.q1: Can I password protect the report?
faq.a1: Yes, sensitive financial data should be secure. You can password protect any public link.
faq.a2: We extract Google Ads data. If you import Salesforce conversions into Google Ads (recommended), we can report on them (e.g., 'Closed Deals').
faq.a3: You can export images of charts or a full PDF to drop into your deck.
faq.a4: SOC 2 compliant infrastructure. Read-only access. We take security seriously for enterprise clients.
faq.a5: Yes, the 'Pacing' widget is a favorite of CFOs. It projects end-of-month spend based on current run rate.
faq.q6: Is it easy to read on mobile?
faq.a6: Designed for busy executives on the go. Retains clarity on iPhone and iPad screens.
faq.a7: Yes, fully white-labeled. Put your company brand on it.
faq.q8: Do I need a Google Ads login?
faq.a8: No. Once connected by the marketing team, executives can view the Flipika dashboard via a simple link without needing Google Ads access.
